Hi Barry, Hamaguriba is a particular type of sword construction that 
has a=
 'thicker' or 'meatier' blade that has a more wedging action to 
a cut, as =
I understand it. Niku, esp. in the hiraji, can refer to 
presence or lack o=
f this in blade construction but is commonly used 
to describe the effects =
of polishing whereas hamaguriba does not. At 
least this is how I've used t=
he term conversationally, maybe 
incorrectly, with others and the intent is=
 generally understood. John
